Journal Story: In 2018 decided I wanted to hike the 105 miles of the AT in Shenandoah National Park.  I found out my Niece Rampaige was doing a thru hike north bound starting March 21.  I ended up meeting up with her and the people she was hiking with at James River Bridge in Virginia first time in May and last time in Killington Vermont in July.   I first met Prophet at Dulles Airport when he flew out to get back on the trail in Harpers Ferry on May 28 with Rampaige and Minnesota.  He had gotten off the trail  in Buena Vista Virginia a couple weeks before. I said I would hike the part missed with him when he came back after summiting Katahdin.  He summitted August 3rd.  We started hiking August 8th.  I will talk about that in journal entry 2.

Prophet and Minnesota  summitted Katahdin August 3 and took the bus to Washington DC August 6.  I started my section hike August 8th. Dropped Prophet off at Buena Vista route 60 and me 8 miles north. I did not want to do Bald Knob and the Priest on first day.  Minnesota hiked SOBO to the Priest shelter after parking car and we all stayed at the shelter on the Priest the first night. Day 2 hiked down the priest and did the 3 ridges. Mini picked us up at the road to Devils Backbone and we camped there after enjoying the brewery.  Day 3 we entered Shenandoah National Park. We got a campsite for 3 nights at Loft mountain.  We were able to slack pack since Mini would drop us off and pick us up each day.  Prophet was ahead of me so she had 2 different drop off and pick ups each day.  After day 6 of hiking we drove the hour to my house and took the next day off. We started back up a Thorton Gap route 211.  I had to skip 19 miles to catch back up. We had planned on staying in shelters next 3 days but we made such good time each day we came back to my house since it was never more than 90 minute drive on this stretch. Hey it was August and I have a pool in my backyard.  Air Conditioning and showers were a bonus as well. Plan on doing the same this year if I am fortunate enough to make it that far.  Ended up finishing August 19 in Harpers Ferry.  I had to skip ahead 9 miles one day to catch back up so we could both finish on the same day.  It was great to hike into Harpers and be with someone that was completing the 2190 journey.  Next journal entry will be about the times and places I met my niece while she was on the trail.  A month from today I drive south to start the journey.               From Facebook post after hike                    Finished my hike on Appalachian Trail Sunday in Harpers Ferry. 11 days and 144 miles on the trail. Fell 2 times. 1 blister and 1 bee sting. Zero ticks. Hit hundreds of  webs. Usually right in the face. Saw 7 Bears all in Shenandoah National Park. Also saw deer turkeys chipmunks owls squirrels hawks rabbits and all kinds of other birds and tons of butterflies. I had a great time. Some days I hiked hours with out seeing a person and would catch up with my group at end of day. Thanks to Prophet and Minnesota (trail names) for hiking with me.

2 weeks from today I head south to Springer.   Rampaige will be flying out from Colorado to hike the first 30 days with me.  After that she will fly to California to start the PCT to finish her triple crown. I am very fortunate to have her to start with.  I had a great time last year following her on the AT.  I would get Spot Me GPS emails to let me know where she was each night.  She started with a friend and they hiked together until Hot Springs. The next 500 miles she was pretty much on her own. We picked her up the first time at James River Bridge for a couple days off at my house.  Dropped her back off and met next time at Southern Entrance of Shenandoah National Park.  Now she was hiking with Minnesota and they came to my house for a day off.  After completing SNP and making it to Harpers Ferry they came back to my house again for a day off.  Prophet Flew to Dulles airport joined them at Harpers.  I told them I would get a condo in Delaware Water gap and meet them in a couple weeks.  I met them at Wind Gap PA first day.  But now the group had grown to 8.  Tiger Lilly, Captain Ahab,  Tortoise, Mr Bean & Zebra.  They slacked packed 3 days than took a zero day. After dropping them off about 20 miles into New Jersey I had the condo for one more day.  The gang had left me a thank you note with words of encouragement about me hiking the AT.  That was the day I realized that I have to do this.  All 8 of these people finished in August 2018.  I met up with them again a month later in Killington Vermont. Minnesota and Prophet were ahead of the group since they skipped the Zero days the others took to go to Captain Ahabs house in Massachusetts.  They still had 8 people because now they had Donut and Thunder who also finished in August.  It was an amazing time just being a trail angel to the gang.  I got to see and smell what it is like to be Thru hiker (hiker trash).  Looking forward to starting March 2 and meeting lots of new people on the trail.
Checked in number 413.  Did 1.1 miles of approach trail.  Staying in lodge tonight. Planning on finishing approach and few more miles tomorrow.  All is well.
Nice hike up approach trail. Only .2 on AT. Stayed in shelter to stay out of rain.
Nice hike.  Great weather today.  About 30 people last night around shelter. Got up early to beat rain today
Sasafras mountain was a good hike.  Was snowing this morning.  Got down to 20 degrees last night

Trail magic 2 times.  The famous OD  had coffee and donuts at Gooch gap.  At woods hole gap Yellow Deli had tea and soup. My legs are starting to get with it. Getting up hills without stopping.  Blood mountain into Neel gap tomorrow.
Cold start but warmed up fast going up blood mountain. Clear skies and beautiful views.  Got picked up for night in house tonight. Will be back at Neel Gap tomorrow to head North again.
Started at 11:30 and made it to Shelter 5:30.   Some good climbs today about 3000 feet total.  Beautiful views all day.  Sunny but only high 32 today.   Lots of young hikers here tonight.
Lots of ups and down. Great views.  Nice campsite.  Long but great day

Rain sleet thunder.   Fun but muddy day. Staying at Hostel and taking tomorrow off.  Had my first fall slipped on mud and landed on my pack.  No pain but got muddy.  Tomorrow we hike into North Carolina.
zero day
another day of big hills. Hit 5000 feet today.
longest day so far.  More 5000 footers.
Made it to 100 mile mark today.
Day off.  Nice weather. Did resupply and went to 2 breweries.  Nice day off
All up hill today.  Went 3400 feet.  Thunder storms all night but stayed dry.
trying to catch up on entries. Will not have much detail in posts until I catch up
hiking into NOC for laundry and resupply
cool campsite
Nice day hiking.  Still lots of snow and ice on trail.  It snowed second day we were in Smokies. Stayed in Shelter because of 40 mile an hour winds.

Hiked quickly today with threat of storms. Got tent set up just in time. Heavy rains all night.  I stayed dry but hiking buddy Recon got rain in tent and all his clothes and sleeping bag were wet.  Good thing heading to Hostel next day so we can dry tents and everything for Recon.

Hiked in ankle deep water with all rain water running down Trail.  Left the Smokies and crossed interstate 40.  Hostel was great.  5 dollar burgers and 3 dollar 16 ounce Sierra Nevada.  Had fun night talking to all the through hikers.
We stayed at Hostel until 1:30.  We want to stay on Max patch Thursday night so only hiked 7 miles today.  Weather was beautiful.  Had 4.6 mile 2400 ascent to start day. Lots of great views today.
Awesome weather and stayed on Max Patch with 360 views.   Sunset and sunrise were great.

First 20 mile day.  Great weather and last day hiking with Rampage.  Excited we made our goal to make it here in 30 days but sad I will be not be hiking with her.  My wife Sally is meeting me today March 30 for a 2 day visit.  Should be a great day.
No hiking today.  Staying in Hot Springs for 2 days off

Another zero day.  My wife sally came down yesterday and we enjoyed are 2 days in Hot Springs.  Monday she is heading home with My Niece I started the trail with.  Our goal to make it to Hot Springs in 30 days was a success.  I learned a lot from her and wish her well on her PCY hike startling April 9
Big climb out of Hot Springs with heavy pack of five days food.  Good views back to city. Slept 9 hours after fun weekend and tough hike.  Nice weather during daytime but cold at night.
Another great weather day with cold at night.  Passed 300 mile mark today.
Great weather today and actually mild this evening.  Had trail magic 2 times today.  Soda and snacks at road crossing around 2 and Fried Chicken and PBR at Shelter. Fun day.

Had trail magic this morning.  Scrambled Eggs and hash browns.   Did shorter day because ankle was not happy today.  Decided better to rest it and was nice to be setup at 4 instead of 7.  Ankle is nothing new.  Started after section hike last year and flares up some days.  Supposed to rain tonight and morning but hope to make it to Erwin Tennessee tomorrow.  16 miles.

Rain started at 1am.  Know this because serious winds shook the tent and woke me before rain started.  Wanted to make it to Erwin today so had to pack up in rain and hit trail at 7:30. Was muddy and slippery. Rain stopped around 11.  More trail magic with father son team cooking burgers and hotdogs and beer and soda. Skipped beer but had the rest.  Made it to hostel in time to set up tent and catch 5 pm shuttle to town. Had Mexican food and beer at nice restaurant.  Recon who I have been hiking with since we met first day picked up tab.  Thanks Recon.  Then Walmart for resupply and beer for night. Got back took shower and did laundry and chatted with other hikers.  Was great to be clean and laundry after 5 days on trail since hot springs.

Took 9 am shuttle to town. Ate McDonalds breakfast and wrote some post cards. Shuttle back at 10:30 packed up and headed out at 1 with heavy pack of 5 days food.  I have not weighed in 10 days but was down 19 pounds than at 232.  Would guess about 225 or less now. My Fitbit says i am burning between 6 and 7 thousand calories a day.  Short miles today with late start and big climb out of town. Supposed to have rain and thunder storms next 3 days.  Hope I can keep tent dry.
long day.  Set up tent than the rain came.  Stayed in tent all evening.
Rain.  Lots of wind and rain. Went over Roan mountain. Last 6000 footer until Mount Washington.
Short day. Great Hostel with craft beer bar.  Got trail name Zombie because young kids say I look like Rob Zombie.
Long day of hiking.  Nothing overly steep but 4000 feet uphill today.  Passed 400 mile mark.
Very warm day.  Had big 5 mile 2000 foot hill towards end.  Fun hostel. Odie the AT yearbook guy here.  Taking zero tomorrow to rest up.
had a relaxing day just hanging out at Hostel and talking to other hikers.  Back on the trail tomorrow
Nice hike out. First 9 miles up hill looking at Lake Watuga.  Rained a little bit but not bad.  Only 25 miles from Virginia.  Trying to get good miles in tomorrow before thunderstorms.  All is well.

Got up early to beat rain.  Did 10.7 by noon and only got rained on last 20 minutes.  Waited at Shelter for 2 guys I am hiking with for 2 hours.  With thunderstorms on way we decided to camp just past shelter.  Storms held of until 8 pm. Going down to 30 tonight. Has been warm last week so tomorrow will be a change. Only 14 miles from Virginia.  All is well.

Crazy night.  We slept in our tents close to shelter.  Had sunshine until around 8 PM than hard rain followed by thunder and lightning.  In morning temps dropped to 30 with sleet. Got late start waiting to dry tent out some and left at 10.  It was windy and cold all morning.  Wind stopped around 2 and it became Sunny and real nice.  Made it to VA and town of Damascus.  Tent camped at Hostel.  Had a good bar and restaurant next door so had a few beers and a half pound burger.  Heading home in morning for 3 days.  Got to town early and guy hiking with me has a doctor appointment on 4/19 that we knew about for awhile.  Since we are not hiking again until 4/20 figured better to go home  to Manassas VA rather than spend 5 nights in Damascus.

Picked up rental car and drove home in 5 hours.  Trip was uneventful.  Weather when I got home was Sunny and 74. When I left Feb 28 it was winter like and now everything is in full bloom.  Tulips and Dogwood trees. Such a big difference.  As you can see by picture my pants are getting a bit baggy.  Heading to REI this week for new shorts and shirt.  I have been wearing Salomon shoes but may switch to Altra 4.0 if they feel good when I try them on.  Have new Salomon that are still in box I can return. I hope the Altra fit because everyone that wears them seems to love them. If not the last pair of Salomon lasted 400 miles which is good since I am heavier than the average hiker and seem to kick everything.  Great to be home and rest up for a few days.   Thanks to all the people that signed by Guest book with words of encouragement. I really enjoyed following hikers last year on this site and will try to add more detail to my entries.

Did a lot of stuff around the house.  I opened the pool.  I usually open first week in May but since I was home and 80 degrees out figured good time to do it.  Now it will be ready in a few weeks when we get closer to home.  My house is only 38 miles from AT where it goes under Interstate 66 past Front Royal.

Went to do my resupply for food.  I will be heading back tomorrow to start on Saturday.  It has been great being home but ready to continue this journey and get closer to home on the trail.  Going to drive down to Abington VA and stay at hotel Friday night.  Then pick up Recon at the rental car place Saturday morning than to Damascus to start back up.  I will be hiking with a friend that is going with me for a week. Will take it easy the first couple days because I remember how my body felt the first couple days out of Springer.
All packed up and will be heading out in a few hours.  Looks like we will hit a few storms along the way.

Got back on Trail with friend Todd.  It rained all day and 39 degrees.  Set up tents and got in dry clothes around 4.   Stayed in tent until morning.  Not best day for us to start but got decent miles in.
Rain in morning than sun finally around 5.  Found good campsite so set up tents to dry out.  Got good campfire going and had supper.
entering Greyson highlands where pony’s run wild.  Really rocky and rough on ankles so low mileage today.  Ponies running around tents all night.  Lots of nice views today
Did big miles today to make up for yesterday.  Warm day. Started at 8 and hiked until 6:30.   Ate dinner and crashed.

Did quick 10 to get to spot for 50!cent bus to Marion.  Had cheesesteak and picked up some resupply at Walmart.  Took bus back and tented by Shelter.  Had some beers and met some hikers from Germany. Nice day
Nice weather today.  Got hotel room to do laundry and get a shower.  That’s done going to go get some dinner.  Lots of wild flowers and budding trees today.  Lots of good smells.

We stayed at the Relax Inn in Rural Retreat.  Trail goes through there and under 81.  It rained most of the day and had heavy downpours.  Lots of water to cross so wet from head to toe. Had to keep moving to stay warm.   Got tent set up just in time before downpours with heavy  winds. Spent a lot of time in tent and wind dryer out tent overnight
Lots of uphill today. Need to be at route 623 at 11 tomorrow so camping here for short walk tomorrow.

Got up early to meet my wife Sally at route 623.  She got there just after me at 11 AM. Got resupply from her and she left with Todd to head home.  I hiked another 10 miles and camped with Two Tone and his buddy Mark.  Nice weather all day
Nice day but a bit warm.  Stopped at outpost on trail and had big cheeseburger.  Found great campsite on ridge to stop for night.

Passed 600 mile mark today.  Another hot day.  Was planning on going farther today but was low on water so went to store half mile from trail.  They had camping for 6 dollars and included laundry and shower.  Also had cold beer.  Decided to stay.

Another very warm day with a 2000 foot 3 mile uphill.  Stayed at famous Woods Hole Hostel.  Great time and first time on trail I had a shower 2 days in a row.  Heading into Pearisberg VA tomorrow for 2 nights to take a day off Friday
Had a great breakfast at hostel than got on trail.  Made it to town at 2. Ready for a day off tomorrow.
Enjoyed day off.  Got food for next 5 days of hiking.  Went to Hardee’s for breakfast and had Tacos and a margaritas for dinner forecast is for storms tomorrow afternoon so will be on trail at 8:30.

I was able to get my tent set up just in time before storms.  Had to carry lots of water because 13 miles without water source.  Also had 5 days of food so pack was heavy.  Saw lots of day hikers today. Storms were not too bad. Lots of rain so stayed in tent.

Rain stopped at 6 am so rushed to get packed up before next round hit trail at 7 and at 7:30 sky’s opened up.  Rained off and on until around 4.  Staying at 4030 altitude.  Only one more 4000 footer Priest mountain right before Devils Backbone brewery until New Hampshire. Hope to gets to Devils Backbone May 18.
Short day.  It was very hot and rocky trail today.  So camped by Shelter.  Lots of people also camping there.  Need to get mile 704 by Wednesday so will need to get more miles tomorrow.

Got enough miles to get to mile 704 tomorrow and Four Pines Hostel.  Need to get food for two days to Daleville.  Another hot sunny day. Two Tone and I camped by the creek. Got fire started and did some Mac and Cheese.  Good day.
Made it to Hostel.  Got shower and did laundry.  They took us to local gas station and deli.  Got some devils backbone beer and a burger.  Also food for next 2 days.  Great day. Passed 700 mile mark
Made it to famous Mcafee Knob today.  It is a great view.  Going into Daleville tomorrow so sleeping in shelter to get an earlier start.

Up early and on trail by 7.  Went by Tinker Cliffs today. Great views.  Got warm in afternoon going through area with lots of power lines  made it to Daleville around 3   Hotel right next to trail and interstate 81   Took nice long shower than went to store for some gator aid and beer  went to bbq place for supper    Supposed to rain all day Saturday so going to stay in town 2 days
Went to Kroger grocery store to resupply fo 4 days to Glasgow Virginia.  Tried to stay off feet to let legs relax.  Rained a lot so was glad I am not hiking.  Back at it tomorrow

Left hotel at 9.  Rained first 2 hours than just cloudy rest of day. Got to Shelter at 6:30.  4,500 feet of uphill today.  Started crossing blue ridge parkway today.  Guess will be doing that a lot next few days. Weather looks good rest of week so plan to cross James River Bridge Wednesday and be at Devils Backbone brewery Sunday.

just a few sprinkles in the morning than rest of day was fine.  Shelter area had no good campsites so stayed in Shelter. This one is biggest on the AT.  Two stories and a porch.  Lots of people there. Ran into a guy I had not seen since Fontana damn.

Two big climbs today.  Did 4000 feet up in first 8 miles.  Tenting by Shelter.  Listening to an owl now before going to sleep.  Getting up early for 14 miles to James River bridge.  Hostel in Glasgow is picking us up there.  Will shower and do laundry and get 4 days of food to make it to Devils Backbone Brewery. My wife Sally is meeting me there to camp for night.  Then only 19 miles to enter Shenandoah National Park.  Weather was clear but only high of 50.  Camping at 4030 elevation tonight.  Will be hard to get out of sleeping bag in morning but need to get up early for more time in town.

Met hostel driver at 2.  Great hostel.  Big living room area with 55 inch Television.  Got laundry done and got a shower.   Went to local restaurant and had a meatball sub.  Went to dollar general for resupply to get to Devils Backbone.  Back at it tomorrow.
Big climbs today.  Like most times when you leave a town.  Camped by a river.  Saw 2 guys fishing and they caught lots of trout.
2700 feet climb to start day.  Lots of great views.  Campsite was in a big meadow with great views.
Long day.  Had lots of locals camping by river.  Stayed by 3 guys from Richmond.  They gave us Steak and beer.  Great trail magic there.  Heading to Devils Backbone brewery tomorrow to meet my wife.
Made it to reeds gap and my wife picked me and two tone up to go camp at brewery campsite.  Fun Day with lots of hikers I have been with last week
Hot day after fun day at Brewery made it a long day. Slept in Shelter
A few small climbs but not too bad.  Got to Shelter at 2:30 and had nice tent sites so decided to call it a day.
Long day to get to Shelter.  Two Tone saw two bears today.  Camp store had cold beer.  Great ending to great day
Short day since started late after lunch in wayside.

Did long day to make up for yesterday.  Lucked out and got to camp for free at full campground.  Lady saw us walking fro Camp store after getting some beer and Gatorade to take to Shelter a mile ahead.  She asked if we're through hikers and we said yes. She was sleeping in her van so said we could set up our tents on her spot.  Awesome trail magic.  Went back to store and got more beer and hotdogs to cook.  Great day hiking and after.  Getting picked up tomorrow to go home.
Up early to meet wife for day and half off.  Two Tone is coming with me.   Saw tons of over night hikers coming out for Memorial Day weekend.  So trails and Shelters will be crowded
Day off.  Re supply at Food lion and trip to REI
Nice day weather wise.  Not too hot with light breeze.  Saw first bear that walked up to shelter.  We took pictures than scared him off.  Slept in shelter.
sprinkled a bit early but turned out to be sunny and warm.  Got to Shelter at 4 and set up tent. I will be leaving Shenandoah Park tomorrow.
Left park and made it to 522 by 1:30.  Had 10.6 by noon.  Since made good miles last 3 days I called Uber to go home.  Was in pool with a beer at 3.  Will take zero tomorrow and go back Friday.
Just hung around the house and got ready  for 54 miles to Harpers Ferry   Will be back on Trail tomorrow
Hiked out with Todd.  Crossed route 50 and started the roller coaster today.  14 mile series of straight up and downs.  Very steep grade. Tented by stream at Shelter

Hiked under root 66 after 8 miles.  Stopped at Manassas Gap Shelter for lunch and filter water.  Hiked 7 more to Shelter.  Friend Todd hiked there from Sky Meadows Park with hot dogs and beer.   Nice weather and on target for Harpers Ferry Monday. Crossed 1000 miles mark today
Finished the roller coaster and got to trail center just before storms.   Run by Potomac AT club.  Made us dinner.  Heading into Harpers for ATC check in

Got up early to get to Harpers as early as I can. Made good time and was in town by 11.  Went to ATC and registered as hiker 475 to make it this far in 2019.  Caught ride to hotel and checked in at noon.  Showered and went to store for resupply for 3 days and beer and food for rest of day. Did laundry and planned out next 3 days to Waynesboro Pa.  r
Walked through historic Harpers Ferry then across bridge into Maryland.  Some rocky areas but not any big elevation climbs.

Expecting storms later today so up and hiking early.   Passed through 3 state parks today so lots of water and bathrooms.  Lots of civil war history on the trail today and Washington Monument State Park as well.  Wish I had more time to spend in the Park but only have 3 dats food leaving Harpers so need to get miles in.  Some really rocky parts today.  Tented at nice site above Shelter.  No storms just light rain for about 30 minutes

On trail by 7 to get in 10 miles to town to resupply and stay in hotel. Climbed Raven Rocks. Steep and rocky up and down. Made it to road and shuttle took me to hotel.  Did laundry and shower.  Walmart next  door for resupply. Did that and got beer and rested and iced ankles and shins rest of day. Crossed Mason Dixon line today.   Now in Pennsylvania
Nice weather.  Good tent sites at Shelter
Another good weather day.  Tented by Shelter.  Passed the halfway mark and 1100 today
Another 19 mile day. Tented by stream at Shelter. Heading into Carlisle tomorrow
Rain started overnight.  Light drizzle for short hike into Boiling Springs. Going to friends house in Carlisle

Had a great day off.   Walked up the street to Walmart and got resupply and ate some McDonald’s.  Rest of day just relaxed.  Staying with friend Marcy and her brother Tom who is a chef made us pasta dinner which was great.
Nice hike out of Boiling springs.  Crossed lots of roads including 81 and Pennsylvania Turnpike.  Tented by Shelter.  Had real nice tenting area.
Woke up to rain.  Rained most of day. Stayed at famous Doyle hotel.  What a dive but for 25 bucks I’ll take it on rainy day.  Got pizza and beer and relaxed.
Nice climb out of town.   Rocky hiking today but not too bad. Got to Shelter and set up tent at 3.  Nice weather day. N
Long rocky hike.  Weather was nice and saw 2 rattle snakes.  Long day. Tented by nice stream.
Another rocky day with good weather.  Ordered pizza since they deliver here to Shelter.

Packed up in the rain this morning.  Trail was rocky and muddy where the rocks where not.   Slipped going down some rocks. Managed to miss hitting any rocks with my head or upper body but my right shin bounced off a rock.  At end of day had a nice cut there after I peeled off my compression sleeve. Rocks are bad enough but when wet it is slow and dangerous but managed to get to Eagles Nest shelter and set tent up to dry out.  Supposed to storm over night.  Meeting friends in Port Clinton tomorrow so will be hiking down hill into town in morning.

Rained most of night. Started out with out rain but had thunder storm that dumped on me for about 20 minutes.  The trail was like a river where not flat and like a pond where it was.  Managed to stay on my feet and make it to town.  Got picked up at Port Clinton post office by friends.  I am going to take some time off to let my various pains heal up.  The shin splints in my left leg and Achilles tendentious in left heal area is what is not getting any better.
